Title: RHSA-2018:3158: sssd security, bug fix, and enhancement update (Low)
Description:
The System Security Services Daemon (SSSD) service provides a set of daemons to manage access to remote directories and authentication mechanisms. It also provides the Name Service Switch (NSS) and the Pluggable Authentication Modules (PAM) interfaces toward the system, and a pluggable back-end system to connect to multiple different account sources.

The following packages have been upgraded to a later upstream version: sssd (1.16.2). (BZ#1558498)

Security Fix(es):

* sssd: information leak from the sssd-sudo responder (CVE-2018-10852)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

This issue was discovered by Jakub Hrozek (Red Hat).

Additional Changes:

For detailed information on changes in this release, see the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.6 Release Notes linked from the References section.

Bugzillas.Title: Incorrect error code returned from krb5_child (updated)
sssd in cross realm trust configuration should be able to use AD KDCs from a client site defined in sssd.conf or a snippet
extend sss-certmap man page regarding priority processing
Document how to change the regular expression for SSSD so that group names with an @-sign can be parsed
ID override GID from Default Trust View is not properly resolved in case domain resolution order is set
Give a more detailed debug and system-log message if krb5_init_context() failed
sssd doesn't allow user with expired password to login when PasswordgraceLimit set
Requesting an AD user's private group and then the user itself returns an emty homedir
SSH public key authentication keeps working after keys are removed from ID view
Certificate is not removed from cache when it's removed from the override
crash in nss_protocol_fill_netgrent. sssd_nss[19234]: segfault at 80 ip 000055612688c2a0 sp 00007ffddf9b9cd0 error 4 in sssd_nss[55612687e000+39000]
The man page of sss_ssh_authorizedkeys can be enhanced to better explain how the keys are retrieved and how X.509 certificates can be used
Rebase sssd to the latests upstream release of the 1.16 branch
externalUser sudo attribute must be fully-qualified
After updating to RHEL 7.5 failing to clear the sssd cache
memory management issue in the sssd_nss_ex interface can cause the ns-slapd process on IPA server to crash
SSSD with ID provider 'ad' should give a warning in case the ldap schema is manually changed to something different than 'ad'.
/usr/libexec/sssd/sssd_autofs SIGABRT crash daily
Samba can not register sss idmap module because it's using an outdated SMB_IDMAP_INTERFACE_VERSION
home dir disappear in sssd cache on the IPA master for AD users
SSSD AD uses LDAP filter to detect POSIX attributes stored in AD GC also for regular AD DC queries
CVE-2018-10852 sssd: information leak from the sssd-sudo responder
SSSD bails out saving desktop profiles in case an invalid profile is found
Offline logins and/or id_provider=local logins fail after upgrade to 7.6
When sssd is running as non-root user, the sudo pipe is created as sssd:sssd but then the private pipe ownership fails
sssd_ssh leaks file descriptors when more than one certificate is converted into an SSH key
